question: I'm worried I've got COVID. Is there a covid screening station in Taichung where I can get a free COVID-19 test?
markdownAnswer:
**6/25** several **health facilities have set up outdoors COVID-19 Fast Screening Stations** to provide rapid antigen testing for free if you have an official address in Taichung.

question: What epidemic alert level is Taiwan in currently? What are the guidelines and rules for Taichung at this moment? What's the COVID-level 2 timeline or end date?
markdownAnswer: **On 7/27 [Taiwan downgraded to level 2](https://www.cdc.gov.tw/En/Bulletin/Detail/C-9A7siqyLWsca5Qb6npkA?typeid=158) and this has been [extended until 9/6](https://www.cdc.gov.tw/En/Bulletin/Detail/C-BcduAEwDoDKg8WkY37Ig?typeid=158. Taichung city government has since published [several articles](https://www.taichung.gov.tw/1174224/1174227/1174251/) with a few major changes: - **Libraries** reopened with restrictions from 8/10 - Maximum **100 people (including you) outdoors, and 50 people (including you) indoors.** - **Indoor dining allowed** at restaurants with mask wearing, temperature checks, 1922 tracking system, and social distancing. - **Cram schools may reopen** upon approval from MOE. Teachers need either 1st dose + 14 days or do regular COVID tests (home test-kits ok), wear face shield cover and mouth mask, and fixed seating plans in classrooms. Summary of current measures: **Obligated/Fined**: Always wear masks outdoors. Those with symptoms should seek medical attention. Businesses must implement crowd control measures. **Open/Allowed with restrictions**: Best check with venues before you head out and all platforms, fitness facilities, children's recreational facilities, and pavilions at tourist venues remain closed. English names from [Tourism & Travel Bureau](https://travel.taichung.gov.tw/en-us/Attractions/List/) - From 8/10: swimming pools, libraries, hot food at stores (served by staff), weddings, memorial ceremonies - Restaurants, cram schools, fitness centers, bowling alleys, and pool halls, movie theaters, - Daan Binhai (Dike and land area), Shigang River Area - Trails/Walkways: Dakeng No. 1 to 8, Tanzi Xintian, Dadu, Wuri Zhi Gao Zhun, Cheng Gong, Daan Mazu, Gaomei Wetland (not beaches, max 691, closes 6pm) - Bikeways: Hou-Fong, Tanya Shen, Daijia - Other: Rainbow Village, Dajia Tiezhenshan Scenic Area - Travel Service Centers at Train Station (max 4 ppl), HSR Station (max 5), Shigang River Area (max 50), Taichung International Airport **Closed/Banned**: - Dakeng No. 9, 9-1, and No. 10 trails, Guguan Hot Spring. - Leisure & entertainment venues, beaches, massage places - All platforms, fitness facilities, children’s recreational facilities, pavilions at tourist venues **Advised**: Social distancing, reduce shopping frequency, distance working, flexible hours, avoid all non-essential travel to all countries. **[No new information since 7/14](https://www.taichung.gov.tw/1174251/Lpsimplelist)** The original article was removed, service desk says these still apply. - Playgrounds, schools & daycare, community services & workshops, sports venues, and places of worship. - Park roads and public toilets may open but sports facilities, pavilions, playgrounds, basketball courts, etc. remain closed. - Night markets may resume business but eating and drinking are prohibited. - Exhibitions and museums by appointment - Outdoor playgrounds of municipal schools according to normal weekday opening hours during the semester. Toilets, playgrounds, and sports fields closed. - The outdoor plaza and parking lot of the Dongshi Hakka Park and Shigang Tuniu Hakka Cultural Hall.

question: When can I get a vaccine in Taiwan? Am I eligible? What are the priorities for vaccination? How can I register for my first dose of Moderna or Astra Zeneca?
markdownAnswer: Vaccination locations and information change almost daily. We've added the main health facilities in Taichung that provide English services to [our covid map](https://www.covid-taichung.com/maps/) and update as we go. **7/13** Anyone older than 18 can now register their "willingness to get vaccinated". We wrote a [separate FAQ about this with detailed instructions](https://www.covid-taichung.com/frequently-asked-questions/#question26). **7/11** For those in groups 9 and 10 that have registered, [text messages will be sent out from 7/13](https://www.cdc.gov.tw/Bulletin/Detail/LFEwMGAQQaE-q0wQ6ioHkQ?typeid=9) and vaccinations will start 7/16. CDC adds that the next 3 weeks will be Astra Zeneca. **7/8** It has been confirmed that anyone in Taiwan aged 18-64 with medical conditions (details below) as well as anyone older than 50 can [make a reservation here](https://1922.gov.tw/vas/) (closed on 7/12 17:00). You will be put on a waiting list and receive a text (SMS) message with further instructions in the coming weeks. - Click the button [Register] (登記) at the bottom of the blue section. On the next page enter both numbers on your NHIC (National Health Insurance Card). - Type the verification code and click the button [Verification] (執行身分認證). If you have a new ARC number (BXXXXXXXXX) and you receive an error, try again with your old number (BCXXXXXXXX) or vice versa. If you are in a priority group because of your job, your employer will inform you. This summary applies to individuals that can book vaccination now and is updated regularly based on feedback from Taichung health centers: - Those required to travel abroad under special circumstances - All people older than 50 years (50-69 on waitlist, +70 has priority) - Pregnant women (talk to your physician) - Adults ages 18-64 with [high-risk diseases](https://reurl.cc/Nr2E36), [rare diseases](https://reurl.cc/R02Qx6), or serious medical conditions (talk to your physician) **6/2** the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) first listed [10 priority groups](https://www.taiwannews.com.tw/en/news/4214853).

question: What to do if your residence (ARC, APRC) or staying permit (VISA) is about to expire?
markdownAnswer:
A summary of this [article](https://www.immigration.gov.tw/5475/5478/141457/141990/264991/) for your convenience:

**ARC or APRC** alien residency certificate holders:
- Automatically extended with 30 days with no upper limit on the number of extensions.
- Extend your leave of stay at a service station no later than 30 days after the pandemic alert has been lowered to level 2 alert.

*VISA holders* (working, student, tourist) or originally had permission to delay departure from Taiwan:
- Do not have to extend leave or stay or delay departure for the time being.
- Extend your leave of stay at a service station no later than 10 days after the pandemic alert has been lowered to level 2 alert.

If you're unable to go into home isolation, put the test kit in sealed plastic bag, visit a nearby clinic or hospital asap and hand it to the staff, wear a mask at all times, and do not use public transport

question: How do I register and book for the COVID vaccination process? How to use the website 1922.gov.tw to apply to get vaccinated?
markdownAnswer: **CDC regularly closes and opens registration and booking for different groups and dates or updates functions on the platform.** We monitor for changes and communicate asap in our vaccination update at the top of this page. Check or download [our step-by-step guide](https://www.covid-taichung.com/vaccination-guide/) for different methods, special cases, and error messages with screenshots and helpful tips and resources in English. Read on for basic instructions. If you have NHI and wish to register online: **(!) You have 10 minutes to complete so have your NHI card and Chinese address ready before you begin.** - Browse to [1922.gov.tw](https://1922.gov.tw/) and click [Register] 登記 in the blue box - Enter ARC and NHI, copy the confirmation code and continue. - Check your info and add your phone (only numbers 09XXXXXXX). Then select county and district, preferred vaccine type(s), and accept terms and conditions. - The next page confirms your choices and shows a registration ID. We recommend taking a screenshot. This is only a registration of your willingness to get vaccinated. You can wait to receive a text (SMS) message from 1922 with further instructions but bookings may open before all the messages were sent and available spots fill up quickly. Check [our 1922 vaccination guide](https://www.covid-taichung.com/vaccination-guide/) to change your preferences (page 4-5) and for various appointment booking methods (page 6-24). If you have NHI and wish to book a vaccination appointment online: **(!) You will get a text (SMS) message from 1922 a few days or weeks after registration but slots may fill up before that. Check our site regularly to know when a new round opens and book immediately.** - Browse to [1922.gov.tw](https://1922.gov.tw/) and click [Reserve] in the green box. - Enter ARC and NHI, copy the confirmation code and continue. - Select county and district, health facility, vaccine type, date and time. Approve terms and conditions. - The next page confirms your choices. We recommend taking a screenshot. Once you complete your booking it is final and can NOT be changed. If you wish to change anything you will have to start over from scratch and may have to wait until a new round for registration and vaccination is opened. Check [our 1922 vaccination guide](https://www.covid-taichung.com/vaccination-guide/) if you receive an error message and for instructions on how to book at health centers, convenience stores,.
